Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: virt is great ... although it depends on how many IPs you end up needing, the DC said they can do NAT, but I preferred to just map IPs to MAC address of the VMs and manage it myself... as every time a coin is added you need to open more ports.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think notary elections this year have been delayed until Q2 ... because we already had 2 hardforks in a year. Election isnt that hard, but I expect this year to be even more competetive. I think I was lukcy to get in last year as it was.

Author: blackjok3r#3181

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
I'd be up for running as a team. Going solo is a bit daunting. More interested in learning the next level than getting rich from it. If it pays for itself, I'd be content. 
Being a wageslave, it's also be nice to know there's a night watchman or two to cover. At worst, I could probably cover cash costs without having to sell KMD just to keep the lights on.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: having a node, gives an income stream to fund the time you spend working on KMD... If your going to stick around here I would advise trying to get one 100%. Its not a huge a ount of work, this year multiple OPs have created almost completly automatic nodes.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: outside of inital setup its not a huge job.

Content:
It would be nice to add some IPv6 forward thinking to the code at some point - sooo much crypto code still lives on IPv4 for seeds etc.
Or at least to make stuff layer agnostic.
It's soo much easier to get a '48 than even a block of 5 IPv4

Author: blackjok3r#3181
